channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Palantir CEO says Gen Z can either have a social life at age 20 or be successful—but they can’t do both
item.description: Gen Z may crave work-life balance, but Palantir boss Alex Karp says the only way to win big is to give up their social life.

item.title: Meet Erika Kirk, the 36-year-old CEO of Turning Point USA, who has three degrees, two kids, and a clothing brand
item.description: Erika Kirk has inherited one of the most influential conservative organizations in America after the assassination of her husband, Charlie Kirk.

item.title: For Trump, Who Has ‘Strong Feelings’ About Autism, the Issue Is Personal

item.title: This Gen Xer sold his tech company to AT&T for billions—he warns if you’re still pushing RTO, you’re not serious about AI

item.title: What Will Jimmy Kimmel Say Tonight?
item.description: The return of the late-night host’s show raises questions about how the Trump administration, TV affiliate owners and viewers might react.

item.title: ‘Shark Tank’ star Lori Greiner doesn’t believe in a 5 a.m. wake-up call: ‘Waking up early doesn’t give you more time. It simply shifts your schedule’
item.description: The “Queen of QVC” wakes up at 8 a.m. to match her body’s natural energy. "Success is about maximizing your energy," she says.

item.title: Social Security chief says he won’t hike the retirement age amid the strain of America’s aging population and fears of benefit cuts
item.description: The administration continues to frame its approach around protecting benefits while exploring other avenues to bolster solvency.

item.title: TikTok Deal Could Make Oracle Founder Larry Ellison a New Kind of Media Mogul
item.description: The database billionaire and his son, David, are Trump favorites. The family could soon control an empire that includes CBS, Paramount, Warner, CNN an...

item.title: Drone Sightings Force Copenhagen and Oslo Airports to Close Temporarily
item.description: It was not clear who was behind the episode, but Denmark’s prime minister called it the “most serious attack so far” on the country’s infrastructure.

item.description: Peter Mutharika, an 85-year-old Yale-educated law professor, looked on course to defeat the incumbent, Lazarus Chakwera.
